items.q: Which actor won their first Oscar for the movie 'The Revenant'?
items.explanation: He won Best Actor for his grueling performance as Hugh Glass.

items.q: The highest-grossing film of the 1990s was 'Jurassic Park'.
items.explanation: The highest-grossing film of the 1990s was 'Titanic' (1997).

items.q: The first fully computer-animated feature film was 'Toy Story'.
items.explanation: Pixar released 'Toy Story' in 1995, revolutionizing animation.

items.q: What is the process of replacing dialogue in a film after shooting called?
items.explanation: It is done to improve audio quality or change lines.

items.q: Which British rock band wrote the rock opera 'Tommy'?
items.explanation: Released in 1969, it tells the story of a deaf, dumb, and blind boy.

items.q: What extremely popular fantasy franchise was created by J.R.R. Tolkien?
items.a: The Lord of the Rings / Middle-earth.
items.explanation: His books defined modern high fantasy.

items.q: In theater, what is the 'fourth wall'?
items.a: The imaginary wall separating the actors from the audience.
items.explanation: 'Breaking the fourth wall' means an actor speaks directly to the viewers.

items.q: Which pop superstar released the hit albums 'Purple Rain' and '1999'?
items.explanation: He was a highly influential and prolific artist.

items.q: What critically acclaimed HBO series focuses on mobster Tony Soprano?
items.explanation: It is widely credited with starting the Golden Age of Television.

items.q: In the film industry, what is an 'EGOT' winner?
items.a: Someone who has won an Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony award.
items.explanation: It is an incredibly rare achievement in entertainment.
